description: After the Austrian mineralogist Matthias Joseph Anker (1771-1843) in 1825  +â€Ž -ite.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) Any of a group of mixed carbonate minerals, principally of calcium with iron, magnesium and manganese.
examples: In this second excavation the red ore is more largely mixed with the micaceous specular variety, and also includes large rounded blocks of ankerite and angular fragments of rock.
